author: Brittany Gracka
title: 360pi to Speak at RetailWire’s “Price It Right” Webinar
text:
Ottawa, Canada: 360pi , the leader in product intelligence, today announced that 360pi CEO, Alexander Rink, will be featured as one of the guest panelists on RetailWire’s upcoming webinar, “ Price It Right: Harness the power of data to drive your company toward profitable growth ”. This webinar will provide exclusive insight into the current state of pricing analytics and the tools retailers and brands have at their disposal to realize a highly-responsive, intelligence-driven pricing program. In a live discussion with RetailWire BrainTrust panelists, this webinar will explore the strategic use of pricing to enhance market image, be more responsive to shopper needs, and infuse excitement into the customer experience. The webinar will also highlight the critical linkage between retailer pricing and market image – each serving to reinforce the other.
“A low price leader and luxury retailer have very different pricing strategies, yet both use price strategically to reinforce their desired image and associated value proposition with their target shoppers,” said Alexander Rink, CEO, 360pi. “Effective data driven pricing starts with understanding your desired market perception to deliver the right price to the right consumer at the right time.”
In a price transparent age, it is important for retailers to know and stay within the acceptable target price range for a specific product, but equally important to look for ways to deliver incremental value to shoppers and margin to their bottom line; all the while staying true to their desired market image. In this panel, Alexander will explore the role data driven pricing plays in supporting an integrated competitive retail strategy.
Register here for the webinar.
About 360pi
360pi derives profitable insights from product and pricing big data to help leading omnichannel retailers, etailers, and brand manufacturers compete and win with shoppers. 360pi’s customer base accounts for over $US200 billion in annual product sales and includes Ace Hardware, Build.com, and Overstock.com, along with several Fortune 500 consumer products companies. With the majority of in-store purchases being influenced online, 360pi helps retailers and brands successfully navigate the multi-channel landscape with real-time insight into who is selling what, where, when, and for how much. Ultimately, 360pi customers make smarter decisions faster to drive increased revenues and margins across all channels.
